chapters.title: The Diagnosis: You're Not Lazy, You're Out of Shape
chapters.summary: Introduces the core premise: procrastination as a weakness in specific cognitive muscles (focus, initiation, follow-through). Helps the reader identify their personal 'weakest muscle group' through a self-assessment.
key_events: Debunks the 'lazy' myth and introduces the fitness metaphor.
Presents the 'Procrastination Physique' assessment quiz.
Identifies the three core 'muscle groups': Focus, Decision, and Execution.
Introduces the concept of the 'Workout Log'.
chapters.ending_hook: Your first workout isn't about finishing a task—it's about simply putting on your gym clothes. Ready for your first rep?

chapters.title: Laying the Foundation: Your Mental Gym
chapters.summary: Sets up the environment and mindset necessary for successful training. Covers creating a distraction-minimized workspace, the importance of ritual, and the concept of 'training sessions' versus 'marathons'.
key_events: The 'Gym Bag' exercise: physically and digitally preparing your workspace.
Establishing the pre-workout ritual: The 60-Second Launch Sequence.
Defining 'Spotter' accountability systems.
Learning to differentiate between true fatigue and mental resistance.
chapters.ending_hook: Your gym is built. Now it's time for the fundamental movement all productivity is built on: The Start.

chapters.title: Workout A: The Starter Set
chapters.summary: The first practical workout chapter. Contains short, foundational exercises designed to build the basic 'muscle memory' of starting without overthinking.
key_events: The 2-Minute Drill: Starting any micro-task for just 120 seconds.
The Decision Sprint: Making 5 small, pending decisions in 3 minutes.
The Fuel Gauge Check: A mindfulness rep to identify real vs. procrastination fatigue.
Logging your 'Personal Record' (PR) for ease of initiation.
chapters.ending_hook: You've completed your first set. Feel that burn? That's your initiation muscle waking up. Next, we teach it to sustain effort.

chapters.title: Workout B: The Focus Flex
chapters.summary: Targets the focus muscle group. Exercises are designed to increase attention span and recover from distraction, treating focus as a trainable skill.
key_events: Single-Task Sprints: Timed, mono-focused work intervals.
The Distraction Drop-Set: Intentionally introducing and dismissing a distraction.
The Peripheral Vision Cleanse: A sensory focus drill.
Increasing your 'Focus PR' by 10% each session.
chapters.ending_hook: Your focus can now hold a heavier load. But what about the chaotic, overwhelming tasks? Time for some mental weightlifting.

chapters.title: The Compound Lift: Taming the Monolith Task
chapters.summary: Teaches how to break down large, intimidating projects into a series of manageable 'lifts'. Introduces the concept of progressive overload for projects.
key_events: The 'Bar-Loading' Technique: Deconstructing a big task into sequential components.
The 'Spotter Call': How to ask for help effectively mid-lift.
The Failure Rep: Practicing a graceful restart after a stumble.
Creating a 'Project Pyramid' set.
chapters.ending_hook: The monolith is now a stack of manageable weights. But to lift them consistently, you need to master the clock.

chapters.title: Workout C: The Interval Timer
chapters.summary: Focuses on time management as interval training. Introduces variations on time-blocking and teaches how to match task type to energy level.
key_events: High-Intensity Interval Tasking (HIIT): Alternating intense focus with active recovery.
The Pace Clock: Finding your natural work/rest rhythm.
Energy-Level Matching: Linking task difficulty to mental fuel.
The 'Cool-Down' Task: A mandatory easy task to end a session.
chapters.ending_hook: You're no longer fighting time; you're pacing it. Now, let's tackle the sneaky saboteur of every gym-goer: the inner critic.

chapters.title: Spotting Your Inner Saboteur
chapters.summary: Addresses the mental and emotional resistance that arises during training. Provides 'spotting' techniques to manage fear of failure, perfectionism, and self-doubt.
key_events: Naming Your 'Gym Troll': Identifying your dominant negative self-talk pattern.
The 'Spotter's Cue' Drill: Replacing criticism with a pre-planned, neutral command.
The 'Good Enough' Lift: Intentionally submitting an imperfect rep.
The Failure Reflection Cooldown: A structured post-setback process.
chapters.ending_hook: Your saboteur is now spotted, not in control. With a clearer mind, what does your ideal productive physique look like?

chapters.title: Designing Your Dream Physique
chapters.summary: Guides the reader in defining their personal, positive vision of productivity—not based on generic hustle culture, but on their own values and goals.
key_events: The 'Productivity Physique' Visualization: What does strong willpower *feel* like?
Value-Based Goal Setting: Aligning tasks with core values for intrinsic motivation.
Identifying 'Vanity Metrics' vs. 'Strength Metrics'.
Drafting a personal 'Training Manifesto'.
chapters.ending_hook: You have your destination. Now we build the advanced routines to get you there, starting with your most valuable asset: creative energy.

chapters.title: Workout D: The Creative Circuit
chapters.summary: Advanced workouts for generating ideas, problem-solving, and maintaining momentum on creative or open-ended projects. Treats creativity as a strength-endurance muscle.
key_events: Brainstorming Sprints: Generating volume without judgment.
The Connective Tissue Set: Forcing novel connections between unrelated concepts.
The Editing Pyramid: A structured rep scheme for revision.
The 'Flow State' Warm-Up: Rituals to invite deep work.
chapters.ending_hook: Your creative engine is primed. But a true athlete knows strength is useless without recovery. Enter the most counterintuitive chapter yet.

chapters.title: Active Recovery: The Discipline of Rest
chapters.summary: Reframes strategic breaks, sleep, and play as essential, scheduled components of the training regimen, not as signs of weakness.
key_events: Scheduled Deliberate Rest (SDR): The non-negotiable break.
The 'Sleep PR': Tracking and optimizing sleep quality as a key metric.
The Play Interval: Unstructured, guilt-free time as a cognitive exercise.
The Digital Detox Cool-Down.
chapters.ending_hook: You are now a balanced athlete. But how do you maintain this when life throws you a chaotic schedule?

chapters.title: The On-The-Go Kit: Travel WODs (Workouts of the Day)
chapters.summary: Provides a toolkit of micro-workouts for chaotic days, travel, low energy, or unexpected disruptions. Emphasizes consistency over perfect conditions.
key_events: The 5-Minute Rescue Set: For when everything goes wrong.
The 'Hotel Room' Workout: Productivity without your usual setup.
The Commute Circuit: Using transitional time effectively.
The 'One-Minute Momentum' Drill to restart a stalled day.
chapters.ending_hook: No excuses remain. You have a workout for every context. It's time to plan for lifelong maintenance.

chapters.title: Your Maintenance Plan & The Next PR
chapters.summary: The culmination. Teaches how to design a sustainable, personalized weekly 'training split' for ongoing willpower maintenance. Looks to the future and setting new 'Personal Records' in life.
key_events: Building Your Weekly 'Training Split': Balancing the different workout types.
Periodization for Projects: Planning intensity cycles for long-term goals.
The Quarterly 'PR Day': Testing your limits in a key area.
Becoming Your Own Coach: How to self-correct and advance your program.
The final 'Graduation Set': A symbolic, comprehensive workout.
chapters.ending_hook: You didn't just read a book. You completed your training. The Procrastination Gym is now yours—a permanent, powerful part of your mind. What's your next PR?
